underlying_goal: To fix a shell script (`clear-mac-apps`) that was failing due to bash version incompatibility issues when run from macOS Shortcuts.
friction_detail: Initial attempts to fix bash compatibility issues were insufficient because the execution environment (macOS Shortcuts) used an unexpectedly old system bash. The final solution required a full conversion to zsh.
primary_success: Successfully converting a script from bash to zsh to resolve environment-specific compatibility issues, adapting syntax for associative arrays, variable manipulation, and conditionals.
brief_summary: A script was failing when run from macOS Shortcuts. Claude diagnosed the problem as the script using features not present in the old version of bash that Shortcuts was executing. After the user suggested it, Claude successfully converted the script from bash to zsh, resolving the compatibility issues.
